column4: I need to find where the option for disabling Compviz is... what is the command-line command for getting to it?  (even if it opens the window, that's fine...)
I don't know command line. DOn't you have access to GUI?
yeah, but I cannot find the option... :-(
idea... can you open the option and tell me what process is running?
System -> Preferences -> Appearance -> Visual Effects
It should be there, but I am running in Japanese... and the option is MISSING.
that shouldn't be the case.
it is.
so...  could you do the "System -> Preferences -> Appearance -> Visual Effects" and tell me what it is running, please?

I understand that it doesn't make sense to you, but this config is what it is... I still need to disable Compviz... and the option is not visible.  Not my fault tha somebody packaged things this way.  But I really do need to disable Compviz and it would be really helpful if somebody usijng an English locale would help out with only the process program name so I came fix things here.
I wish I could help, but I do not know the command line
OK... no prob... I will tell you the command you need to type. (I'm old school)
FIRST, open up that Compviz thing.
SECOND, open up a gnome-terminal
THIRD, in the terminal type the following on the command line: ps -ef
The last new lines should contain the Compviz thingy.
That's it... got it?
yes got it
what did the "ps" show?
I am not using compiz. :-)
you don't need to be... you do have the option in your menu don't you?
just do a "System -> Preferences -> Appearance -> Visual Effects" and tell me what is the name of the program running, please?
Now I am not even asking you about Compviz.
